author: Anita Merritt
title: Police release attempted murder suspects
text:
Police release attempted murder suspects Police are appealing for witnesses following the stabbing in Dartmouth Share
Police have released two suspects arrested in connection with the attempted murder of a man in his 20's in Dartmouth.
Following reports of a disturbance outside a property in the Townstal area at around 1.40am last Thursday, December 6, police and an ambulance attended and located a man on the street in Britannia Avenue who had sustained a number of significant stab wounds to the chest. Read More Half of Devon wants a second vote on Brexit - and most would vote remain
Two local people, a 22-year-old woman and a 26-year-old man were arrested on suspicion of attempted murder, and both have since been released under investigation pending further enquiries.
Police are appealing for witnesses and would like to hear from anyone who may have information that can assist with the investigation. Read More Horse rider injured in a hit-and-run, police hunt driver
Firearms officers were deployed plus local units and support from the police dogs to undertake area searches for the suspects.
The injured man was taken to Derriford Hospital and he is said to be in a stable condition. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
Please contact 101 quoting log number 48 for the 6 of December. You can also give information anonymously via Crimestoppers on 0800 555 111. Like us on Facebook
